topic.title: How do I make the "Read more" link on a ZeroBlog post?
topic.body: [This](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:70:The+first+year+of+ZeroNet) post shows only the first paragraph when browsing the post list. How can I do that?

1_1ALXyaQsvvCQ3R5WBrPbe4dXsqnLCLEkB7.body:
> [gomzik](#comment_61_1F6BMqittjWUStzUbRXm2kG2GQ3RdBLqFQ): 
> Use
> \---
> in place, where you want to separate post

Thanks for the help!

3_168qV1Xxp2EyszrzdECLUwXrn9wGYjDdar.body: My blog is different. I will tell you about all the bullshit from life. Interested yet? Good. [Boom](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LfW2jrhzPF1pFSy5yQRMaVPvoNhsZMTBE). The first post was about a fucking roach. [No. Joke.](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LfW2jrhzPF1pFSy5yQRMaVPvoNhsZMTBE/?Post:1)

2_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body:
> [m1kc](#comment_6_15hCdBiDLoPBUyA2nkj1Loob872RrMJXeZ): What is love?

Love is desire. It's the feeling you get when you know you can have the person but just *being* with them is enough. It's sex, happiness, emotion and it's friendship. Love is knowing that out of all the crazy people in the world that one is the chosen one. It's understanding and a feeling of completion. Love is a chemical reaction that stayed with us because of its efficiency in getting us to fuck and have babies.

Love transcends explanations. It's completely intangible and yet something that most people can feel.

Love is a feeling that when goes away makes you empty, makes you feel like all that love was a lie, that nothing makes sense, that only a new love will make things better.

Well, let's not fool ourselves. Love is a ***reward*** to and an incentive of sex. How could we reward something that is no more?

That is why I say: love everyone, enjoy life, share love and get love but never let love *become* you, it's only good while it lasts.

> [m1kc](#comment_7_15hCdBiDLoPBUyA2nkj1Loob872RrMJXeZ): One little question: where are you from? I'm asking because that sounds like a definition of love that a parent would give to their children. I'm from Russia, and people here talk about love in completely different manner.

I would rather not say where I am from.

That was the most no-bullshit answer I could think of. 

> Also, I was expecting "Baby don't hurt me" much more than an actual answer, but that stuff is probably too obvious to mention.

That's pretty funny.

I would like to know how love is defined in Russia, would you mind sharing?

1_185DbM1bicB5M1wmxkPPVjaUH9mVrHzL8.body: Not sure, haven't seen one yet. You can create a blog by following [this](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:3:How+to+have+a+blog+like+this) tutorial. I'd read it :)
Actually, by definition, my blog had two posts kind of LGBT-leaning. [Boom](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LfW2jrhzPF1pFSy5yQRMaVPvoNhsZMTBE). I'll write more posts soon.

1_1JKjdEGjhxQxn7jAUM9kcHAqDEFF5TpxGQ.body: I'm not *gay*, but I think some of my content would interest you. [Here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LfW2jrhzPF1pFSy5yQRMaVPvoNhsZMTBE). There is one about [sex](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LfW2jrhzPF1pFSy5yQRMaVPvoNhsZMTBE/?Post:2).

> [up4](#comment_4_1BLPKyrF2D4ertte6JnAa6oWAMYzZGwKQz): You like sex with men (as per your own blog). I'm saying this because putting emphasis on you not being gay doesn't seem to me like a super nice way to say « hey you gay come to my place and let's talk ». And gee ! I'm sure gay people on your blog (and in your life) would do you no harm, on the contrary. ;-)
> Pax

Sorry, I didn't mean that to sound like a negative or offensive statement. I wrote it that way because I understand *gay* as homosexual and I consider myself pansexual. That's why I used italics. But of course I have no shame in saying that I like male, female and everything in between :)

8_16w7UuJAHbt8YBa8zxHS7UFk9mq8Q5DpE4.body:
> [planespherev2](#comment_42_1C9BTLZFTprZPJXkg9vPuZLBr3LeaxB7nj): THANK YOU!

What do you think about anarcho-communism?

1_1AhXDbKvcLap7TcS2542J7bFYzKHM3xeRU.body:
> [truth](#comment_4_164W1rFVD9Bm7poGJWvjVUjvkbhhFC5nnt): Yes this is how you do it. Everyone has their own stuff and have to know how to be a proper responsible owner. It is Anarcho-capitalism.

[Anarcho-capitalism has never been and will never be anarchism because anarchism is the antithesis of capitalism](http://anarchism.pageabode.com/afaq/secF1.html)
